intro: Tetracarpidium conophorum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular houseplant. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and relatively easy to care for in a domestic setting.
